{{color box|yellow}}{{color box|navy}} |chairman = {{flagicon|Turkey}} [[Aziz YÄ±ldÄ±rÄ±m]] |manager = {{flagicon|Brazil}} [[JosÃ© Roberto GuimarÃ£es|ZÃ© Roberto]] |captain = {{flagicon|Turkey}} [[Seda TokatlÄ±oÄlu]] |league = [[Turkish Women's Volleyball League]] |season = 2010-11 |position = '''Champion''' |website = http://www.fenerbahce.org/voleybolbayan | leftarm1 = ffff00 | body1 = ffff00 | rightarm1 = ffff00 | pattern_b1 = _navystripes | shorts1 = 000066 | pattern_s1 = 000066 | leftarm2 = 0000FF | body2 = 0000FF | rightarm2 = 0000FF | pattern_b2 = | shorts2 = 0000FF | pattern_s2 = | leftarm3 = FFFFFF | body3 = FFFFFF | rightarm3 = FFFFFF | pattern_b3 = _whitestripes | shorts3 = FFFFFF | pattern_s3 = }} {{FenerbahÃ§e S.K. sections}} '''FenerbahÃ§e Universal'''[http://www.fenerbahce.org/voleybolbayan/detay.asp?ContentID=26123 FenerbahÃ§e Universal] , as known as '''Yellow Angels''', is the women's [[volleyball]] department of [[FenerbahÃ§e S.K.]], a major [[sports club]] based in [[Istanbul]], [[Turkey]]. The senior team's name sponsor is the Turkish healthcare group Universal Hospitals Group. '''FenerbahÃ§e Women's Volleyball Team''' play their matches in the 7000-seated [[Burhan Felek Sport Hall]]. ==Previous names== * '''FenerbahÃ§e''' (1928â2007) * '''FenerbahÃ§e AcÄ±badem''' (2007â2011) * '''FenerbahÃ§e Universal''' (2011âpresent) ==History== Women's Volleyball Department of FenerbahÃ§e SK was founded in 1928 by Sabiha RÄ±fat GÃ¼rayman who was a girl playing for men's volleyball team of FenerbahÃ§e, and was the first woman architect of Turkey. However, the department was closed due to lack of opponent. In 1954 a new era started with taking help from ÃamlÄ±ca Girls' Highschool, starting from 1958 those girls won 8 Turkish Championships alongside many titles. In 1977, FenerbahÃ§e SK Women's Volleyball Branch was closed due to financial issues. In 1989, it was refounded and promoted from Istanbul First League to the Turkish Second League in 1993 and to the Turkish First League in 1994. They were relegated to the Turkish Second League in 1995-96 season.{{Citation needed|date=August 2011}} The senior team was renamed as '''FenerbahÃ§e AcÄ±badem''' due to sponsorship agreement with [[AcÄ±badem Healthcare Group]] from 2007 to 2011.{{Citation needed|date=August 2011}} FenerbahÃ§e finally returned to the First League in 2002-03 season.FenerbahÃ§e finished 2nd in 2006-07 and 2007-08 seasons. They gained their 9th Turkish title in the history in 2008-09 season with beating 3-2 their archrival EczacÄ±baÅÄ± SK in the final and it was their first ever title since league system was applied.{{Citation needed|date=August 2011}} FenerbahÃ§e Women's Volleyball shine in 2009-10 season without a loss in both of Turkish and European competitions and still continue their unbeaten run.They finished 1st the first round of 2009-10 season without a loss in 22 matches and reached the final of [[Women's CEV Champions League]] without a loss, after beating hosts [[RC Cannes]] 3-2 (22-25, 21-25, 25-22, 25-20, 9-15) in final-four that is held in [[Cannes]]. In the final they faced [[Volley Bergamo]] and lost the match. [[Yekaterina Gamova]] won the best scorer and [[NataÅ¡a OsmokroviÄ]] won the best server awards.{{Citation needed|date=August 2011}} FenerbahÃ§e Women's Volleyball were on top of the world on [[21 December]] [[2010]] in [[Doha]]-[[Qatar]] after beating South American titleholders [[GrÃªmio de VÃ´lei Osasco|Sollys Osasco]] 3-0 (25-23, 25-22, 25-17) to become the first team in 16 years to claim the [[2010 FIVB Women's Club World Championship]][http://www.fivb.org/viewPressRelease.asp?No=27475&Language=en Fenerbahce crowned Women's Club World champions] where [[Katarzyna SkowroÅska]] selected the tournement [[MVP]]. SkowroÅska also won the best scorer and [[Eda Erdem]] won the best server awards. ==Current squad== ''Squad as of November 17, 2011'' [http://www.fenerbahce.org/kurumsal/detay.asp?ContentID=9485 Team
